metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20179 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in pki-core. An attacker who has successfully compromised a key could use this flaw to renew the corresponding certificate over and over again, as long as it is not explicitly revoked. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity.

criterions.comment: dogtag-pki: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
